workflow.name: Personalized sales outreach with Apollo, GPT, and Gmail automation
workflow.description:
This n8n template shows you how to turn outbound sales into a fully automated machine: scrape verified leads, research them with AI, and fire off personalized cold emails while you sleep.

Use cases are simple: scale B2B lead gen without hiring more SDRs, run targeted outreach campaigns that don’t feel generic, and give founders or agencies a repeatable system that books more calls with less effort.

**Good to know**
- At time of writing, each AI call may incur costs depending on your OpenAI plan.
- This workflow uses Apollo/Apify for lead scraping, which requires an active token.
- Telegram approval flow is optional but recommended for quality control.

**How it works**
- Define your ICP (role, location, industry) in the workflow.
- Generate Apollo search URLs and scrape verified contacts.
- AI enriches leads with personal + company research.
- Hormozi-style cold emails are generated and queued for approval.
- Approve drafts in Telegram, then Gmail automatically sends them out.

**How to use**
- Start with the included Schedule Trigger or replace with a Webhook/Form trigger.
- Adjust ICP settings in the Set node to fit your target audience.
- Test with a small batch of leads before scaling to larger runs.

**Requirements**
- Google Sheets, Docs, Drive, and Gmail connected to n8n
- Apollo/Apify account and token
- OpenAI API key
- Telegram bot for approvals

**Customising this workflow**
- Swap Apollo scraping with another data source if needed.
- Adapt the AI prompt for a different email tone (formal, friendly, etc.).
- Extend with a CRM integration to sync approved leads and outreach results.

workflow.name: Automate AI-powered B2B outreach from Apollo to Gmail

messageValues.message:
=You are a URL generation agent. Your task is to convert natural language input into a valid Apollo search URL string.

[OUTPUT FORMAT]
- Always output as:  

https://app.apollo.io/#/people?[query_parameters]

[RULES]
1. Encode all values using URL encoding (e.g., spaces become %20, commas become %2C).
2. Use query parameters based on recognized Apollo filters:
   - organizationLocations[] for countries or cities
   - organizationNumEmployeesRanges[] for employee counts
   - qKeywords for keyword search
   - sortAscending=false and sortByField=%5Bnone%5D by default
   - page=1 by default
3. Concatenate parameters using &.
4. Output must match this example style:
   
https://app.apollo.io/#/people?organizationLocations[]=United%20States&sortAscending=false&sortByField=%5Bnone%5D&page=1&qKeywords=digital%20marketing%20agency&organizationNumEmployeesRanges[]=1%2C10

[NATURAL LANGUAGE EXAMPLES → OUTPUT BEHAVIOR]
- "Digital marketing agencies in the US with 1–10 employees"  
→ organizationLocations[]=United%20States, organizationNumEmployeesRanges[]=1%2C10, qKeywords=digital%20marketing%20agency

- "AI startups in Canada with under 50 employees"  
→ organizationLocations[]=Canada, organizationNumEmployeesRanges[]=1%2C50, qKeywords=AI%20startup

Always return the URL exactly in the format shown.

values.content:
=Using the information provided about the company below, produce a succinct 3–5 sentence overview that captures its core identity, focus, and market position. Then, list exactly three bullet points highlighting the most notable or interesting achievements, innovations, or milestones from the company’s history or recent activities.

Company information:
{{ $json.text }}

Instructions:

Identify the company’s primary industry, products/services, and market scope from the provided text.

Focus the summary on what makes the company stand out (e.g., scale, unique positioning, key innovations, partnerships, market impact).

For the bullet points, prioritize tangible achievements such as major product launches, significant awards, record-breaking performance, notable partnerships, or impactful social initiatives.

Use clear, professional language and keep both the summary and bullet points strictly fact-based.

Avoid repeating information across the summary and bullet points—each should add distinct value.

=You are an expert in high-impact cold email outreach in Alex Hormozi’s style. 
You will be given:
- Prospect details
- Research about the person & their company
- Information about CommIT Smart and its services
- A detailed ServiceDoc describing services, KPIs, and outcomes

Your job:
Write ONE personalized cold email ≤100 words in a casual, spartan tone (like talking to a friend). 
NEVER output intros or outros—only the message body.

Inputs:
First Name: {{ $('Loop Leads').item.json.first_name }}
Headline: {{ $('Loop Leads').item.json.headline }}
Job Title: {{ $('Loop Leads').item.json.title }}
Company Name: {{ $('Loop Leads').item.json.organization_name }}
Personal Research: {{ $('personal Research').item.json.message.content }}
Company Research: {{ $('company Research').item.json.message.content }}
Brand Name: {{ $('Lead setup').item.json.brand_name }}
Booking link: {{ $('Lead setup').item.json.booking_link }}
ServiceDoc: {{ $json.content }}

### Connection-Finding Logic:
1. From Personal/Company Research, identify the main business goal or pain.
2. Select ONE best-fit service from the ServiceDoc based on role, KPIs, triggers, and keywords.
3. Tie the measurable outcome directly to a KPI relevant to the prospect’s role. 
   - If KPI data is missing, infer the most likely KPI for that role from the ServiceDoc.
4. Use the prospect’s actual job title in the email (shorten if too long, e.g., "Head of Operations").
5. Select from ServiceDoc: 
   - ONE measurable outcome tied to the KPI
   - ONE **AI-related credibility hook** from CommIT Smart’s delivery history (examples: AI-powered support deflection, AI-driven product recommendations, NLP-based guided selling assistants, AI-powered product data classification)
   - ONE guarantee, with KPI explicitly included in the guarantee
6. If no clear match, default to “Automation” with a process efficiency KPI.

### Email Strategy:
- Lead with a verifiable fact from research to show it’s not a mass email.
- State a measurable offer tied to their KPI and the chosen service.
- Add one credibility hook that highlights AI we’ve delivered.
- Remove risk with the guarantee tied to the KPI.
- Direct CTA: booking link + two fallback times.
- End with “Best regards, CommIT Smart Team” (no personal names).

### Template:
Hi [First Name],

Noticed [specific relevant detail]. I help [their role/title] cut [pain point metric, e.g., manual reporting time] by 40–60% in 30 days using AI automation.

Recently built an AI workflow that [credibility hook, e.g., auto-generated sales reports + client updates → saved 15 hrs/week].

If you don’t see measurable [KPI, e.g., time saved or cost reduction] in the first month, you don’t pay.

Book a 15-min slot: [Booking Link]

Best,
Tamas Demeter

### Quality Rules:
- ≤100 words
- Specific metric + timeframe
- No fluff, no generic claims
- One service per email
- All details must be supported by provided inputs or ServiceDoc (no inventing facts)
- Credibility hooks must feature AI-related solutions we’ve delivered

=For this custom email, generate me an Alex Hormozi-style two-word subject line.

Output in json - Subject:

parameters.content:
## 1. Lead Generation & Enrichment

Set ICP → URL Generator (Apollo)

Scrape Leads (Apify) → Write Leads (Sheet)

Fetch Company Site → Clean Website HTML

Company Research (AI) + Personal Research (AI)
Result: Enriched lead rows with verified contact + company/person insights.

## 2. Personalized Message Creation

Pull Service Doc (Google Docs)

Personal Message (AI, ≤100 words, KPI-tied)

Update Lead Record (Sheet) with research + message

SubjectLine (AI): two-word, punchy
Result: Each lead has a custom email + subject in the sheet.

## 3. Approval & Sending

Get approved leads (Sheet filter)

Loop Approved Emails → SubjectLine → Send Email (Gmail)

Optional: add CRM sync/backoffs later
Result: Only approved, personalized emails are sent.

### Who it’s for

Founders, agencies, and B2B teams that want scalable outbound without hiring SDRs.

### What it does

This workflow turns your ICP into an Apollo search, scrapes verified contacts (via Apify), enriches each lead with website + AI research, writes everything to Google Sheets, and generates a concise, KPI-tied cold email. You can cap batch size for safe testing, then send approved emails via Gmail.

### How it works

Define role + location in Set ICP.

Build the Apollo URL with URL Generator.

Scrape Leads (Apify) → Write Leads (Sheet).

Fetch company site (HTTP) → Clean Website HTML → Company Research.

Personal Research (AI) on the prospect.

Create a ≤100-word Personal Message using your Service Doc.

Update the sheet with research + custom email.

Send Email after approval (or start manual).

### Setup

Add credentials (Google, Apify, OpenAI). In Setup (Set node), paste your Sheet IDs, Doc ID/URL, brand, and booking link.

### Requirements

Google Sheets/Docs/Drive/Gmail, Apify token, OpenAI key.

### Customize

Swap Apollo, adjust prompts, or sync outcomes to your CRM.

## Lead Sheet Headers

status,first_name,last_name,organization_name,industry,title,seniority,headline,email,linkedin_url,country,city,short_description,keywords,seo_description,organization_website_url,organization_linkedin_url,num_of_employees,estimated_revenue,market_cap,organization_city,Personalized Message,Company Research,Personal Research

json.title: Project Manager
json.headline: Driving IT transformations through automation
json.seo_description: Experienced IT project manager delivering SaaS automation solutions.
json.Company Research: TechNova specializes in cloud-based IT solutions for SMEs.
json.Personal Research: Anna has led multiple SaaS-focused digital transformation projects.
json.short_description: Specialist in digital transformation projects with a focus on SaaS tools.
json.Personalized Message: Hi Anna, I noticed your focus on SaaS automation – we recently helped a Berlin-based firm cut dev hours by 40%.

json.title: Head of Operations
json.headline: Scaling sustainable food supply chains
json.seo_description: Leader in sustainable food supply chain management.
json.Company Research: GreenHarvest focuses on sustainable food distribution across the UK.
json.Personal Research: James has been in supply chain management for over 15 years.
json.short_description: Expert in supply chain optimization within the food industry.
json.Personalized Message: Hi James, your work in sustainable supply chains is inspiring. I’d love to share an automation case study relevant to food logistics.

json.title: Chief Technology Officer
json.headline: Driving digital health innovation
json.seo_description: CTO leading digital health initiatives in Italy.
json.Company Research: MedCare provides digital health platforms and AI diagnostic tools.
json.Personal Research: Lucia is recognized as a thought leader in AI-driven healthcare solutions.
json.short_description: CTO passionate about digital health and medical AI applications.
json.Personalized Message: Hi Lucia, I saw MedCare’s recent AI initiative – we’ve helped healthcare firms accelerate AI adoption with compliant automation.

json.title: Business Development Manager
json.headline: Expanding clean energy adoption
json.seo_description: Renewable energy business developer expanding European footprint.
json.Company Research: BrightSpark invests in and develops renewable projects across the EU.
json.Personal Research: David recently led a major wind farm partnership in the Netherlands.
json.short_description: Focused on scaling solar and wind projects across Europe.
json.Personalized Message: Hi David, your push for solar adoption caught my eye – we’ve automated reporting for renewable firms across Europe.

json.title: Product Director
json.headline: Building the next generation of learning platforms
json.seo_description: Senior product leader shaping the future of EdTech.
json.Company Research: EduFuture builds SaaS platforms for digital classrooms.
json.Personal Research: Elena has launched multiple award-winning EdTech products.
json.short_description: Product leader specializing in digital learning experiences.
json.Personalized Message: Hi Elena, your work on interactive learning aligns with projects we’ve automated in education tech.

json.title: Portfolio Manager
json.headline: Optimizing portfolios with data-driven strategies
json.seo_description: Portfolio manager leveraging data to drive investment returns.
json.Company Research: FinEdge Capital provides asset management services in the UAE.
json.Personal Research: Omar has a strong track record in equity investments.
json.short_description: Specialist in equity and alternative investment portfolios.
json.Personalized Message: Hi Omar, I noticed FinEdge’s focus on alternative assets – we help finance firms automate reporting to save 100+ hours monthly.

json.title: E-commerce Director
json.headline: Transforming online retail experiences
json.seo_description: E-commerce director growing fashion brands online.
json.Company Research: StyleHouse runs e-commerce for fashion brands in France.
json.Personal Research: Claire has experience in digital marketing and e-commerce platforms.
json.short_description: Driving growth in fashion e-commerce platforms.
json.Personalized Message: Hi Claire, I saw StyleHouse’s online expansion – we’ve helped retailers scale automation in e-commerce ops.

json.title: Operations Director
json.headline: Modernizing construction operations with digital tools
json.seo_description: Senior leader in construction project operations and technology adoption.
json.Company Research: BuildPro is a major Polish construction firm with a tech adoption focus.
json.Personal Research: Mateusz has 20+ years of experience in construction operations.
json.short_description: Experienced in construction project delivery and digital adoption.
json.Personalized Message: Hi Mateusz, BuildPro’s focus on digital construction tools is exciting – we recently built an automation for project scheduling.

json.title: Chief Marketing Officer
json.headline: Reinventing health insurance engagement
json.seo_description: Executive marketing leader in health insurance innovation.
json.Company Research: HealthFirst is a US health insurance company focusing on digital customer engagement.
json.Personal Research: Sophia is an award-winning marketing leader with 15+ years in healthcare.
json.short_description: CMO leading digital-first health insurance marketing strategies.
json.Personalized Message: Hi Sophia, your shift to digital-first engagement aligns with automation projects we’ve done for major insurers.

json.title: CEO
json.headline: Scaling Nordic SaaS globally
json.seo_description: CEO scaling Nordic SaaS products to global audiences.
json.Company Research: NordicTech develops SaaS tools for SMEs and startups.
json.Personal Research: Johan is a serial entrepreneur with two successful exits.
json.short_description: Founder scaling SaaS platforms from the Nordics to global markets.
json.Personalized Message: Hi Johan, congrats on NordicTech’s expansion – we’ve worked with SaaS CEOs to streamline lead gen with automation.

user.name: Tamas Demeter
user.bio: 👋 I’m Tamas, an IT Project Manager/DevOps Engineer turned Automation Builder. I create practical, business-ready n8n workflows that save time, reduce manual work, and scale processes. My focus: AI-powered automation, lead generation, and content systems for solopreneurs, SMEs, and agencies.
